metadata.title: 2018 Best Colleges for Agricultural Sciences
metadata.subtitle: in America
metadata.description: The Best Colleges for Agricultural Sciences ranking is based on key statistics and student reviews using data from the U.S. Department of Education. The ranking compares the top agricultural science degree programs including horticulture, aquaculture, agronomy, crop science, and turf management.

related.title: 2018 Best Colleges
related.subtitle: in America
related.description: The Best Colleges ranking is based on rigorous analysis of academic, admissions, financial, and student life data from the U.S. Department of Education along with millions of reviews from students and alumni. The ranking compares more than 1,000 top colleges and universities in the U.S.

related.title: 2018 Best Colleges for Environmental Science
related.subtitle: in America
related.description: The Best Colleges for Environmental Science ranking is based on key statistics and student reviews using data from the U.S. Department of Education. The ranking compares the top colleges for earth sciences, geology, forestry, meteorology, and climatology.

related.title: 2018 Top Colleges for Veterinary Studies
related.subtitle: in America
related.description: The Top Colleges for Veterinary Studies list is based on key statistics and student reviews using data from the U.S. Department of Education. Compare top veterinary schools, vet tech programs, and other veterinary science degree programs.

related.title: 2018 Top Colleges for Food Science and Nutrition
related.subtitle: in America
related.description: The Top Colleges for Food Science and Nutrition list is based on key statistics and student reviews using data from the U.S. Department of Education. Compare top colleges for food science, nutrition, and dietitian programs.

related.title: 2018 Best Colleges for Biology
related.subtitle: in America
related.description: The Best Colleges for Biology ranking is based on key statistics and student reviews using data from the U.S. Department of Education. The ranking compares the top degree programs for biology majors including ecology, marine biology, microbiology, biotechnology, botany, and pre-medicine programs.

related.title: 2018 Best Colleges for Engineering
related.subtitle: in America
related.description: The Best Colleges for Engineering ranking is based on key statistics and student reviews using data from the U.S. Department of Education. The ranking compares the top engineering schools in the U.S.

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I love Murray State with a burning passion! The community they've built on campus is amazingly homey and comforting. There are always people willing to talk to you and it's a smaller school so there aren't a million people on campus, which helps. When you come in as a freshman, you get to do great beginnings which is basically just a giant ice breaker and really helps to get you started in that homey vibe. A very diverse population on campus and so many services I probably don't even know all of them, including free counseling services and free gym.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Mississippi State University is such a wonderful college choice, for so many reasons. Prior to coming here, I was highly indecisive between Mississippi State and Ole Miss. After my first visit to MSU, I was completely in love with the academics, campus, and town! I will forever be a huge proponent for MSU, and everything that it has have to offer. MSU has offered me so much just in the two semesters I have been here. I am majoring in Kinesiology, and every single of one the professors in this department are so helpful, and truly want to watch each student succeed. The professors in this department are particularly wonderful in assisting their students to get into grad school. Additionally, I have had a number of ways to get involved and volunteer for different organizations. I love seeing the diversity here at MSU, and at the same time realizing that we are all here for one goal, and that is being taught to be well-rounded professionals for “the real world”.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
I like UConn because it really gives ample opportunities for anyone to pursue their interests and diverge further in that field. It is very diverse with people from all around the world. The professors are very helpful and there is a common theme of "the mission to education" where every person is working with another to improve the educational experience for everyone. 
Although having large classes might be an advantage for some people, it minimizes the interaction between the students, which could be improved. Students don't interact very well in classes and rely on extracurricular activities or living on campus to get to know more people. Additionally, another area where the university can improve is the campus food! The dining halls don't present a variety of options, which makes it hard for some people to find what is right for them.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: South Dakota State University is a place I have been able to grow and succeed in my college career so far. I believe that a diploma from SDSU is as good as any college in the nation. The professors on campus are ready and willing to help, the clubs are fun and involved, and most of all the campus will make you feel right at home. The people that make up SDSU are top notch and in my opinion there is no place better!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: The University of Idaho is great place to get an education. I have gone to both Washington State University and the University of Idaho, and I believe the University of Idaho gives students a very high chance to succeed. I love the University of Idaho because to the faculty and staff, you are not just a number like you are at larger schools such as WSU. These people here actually care about you and take the time to get to personally know you and understand you and try and get the most out of you. Another thing is, professors at UI do all they can to help you find internships and jobs because they actually care and want everyone to succeed. I would highly recommend the University of Idaho. Go Vandals!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Niche User
featuredReview.body: I have found SIU to be an amazing experience! I love being surrounded by nature and having tons of local wineries and breweries close by. The party seen at this school is pretty good and has a strong tradition here. My professors always go above and beyond for me whenever I have a question. Another aspect of SIU is that they offer special dietary services in their dining halls. A friend of mine had Celiac Disease freshman year and I was amazed to see how much they provided for her so that she could feel comfortable eating. She told me that they even have allergy kitchens on both sides of the dining halls! Overall, I loved my time here as a Saluki and would recommend this college to anyone and everyone!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: The University of Tennessee is a great school.  This school heavily emphasizes research, so if you happen to get professors who are there for research and teach because they have to then you may have a lacking experience.  However, I have had wonderful professors who really care about your education.  This school offered many experiences and organizations to be involved in, and I am sure I would have enjoyed college much more if I lived on campus and got involved.  Overall the campus was amazing and my education was as well. You get out of it what you put into it!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: The University of Kentucky is one of the best universities I've ever been to!  The campus is beautiful and everyone is so welcoming.  I felt at home the first time I visited and automatically I knew UK was the school I wanted to attend.  There's a whole week of activities in August before classes start specifically for incoming freshman to get them acclimated to the university and show them everything UK has to offer.  There are numerous tutoring services and most professors are flexible with their office hours to find a time that works for the student.  Almost everyday there's a different activity happening on campus, from goat yoga and Pinterest parties for stress relief, to live music and food to spend time with friends, to tailgates before sports games to support our Wildcats with the most spirit.  It's clear that the university strives to create the best environment for students' success and well-being.  I'm so glad I picked the University of Kentucky!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: In 2010 I started my Bachelor's Business Administration Major and I have only 18 more credits to go!  The teachers, advisors and entire college atmosphere is both accommodating, and convenient for my educational experience.  I highly recommend this university in PA.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Missouri State University provides a plethora of opportunities to its students including recreational, pre-professional, and social activities. We have excellent staff who really care about the students as people, not as numbers. Missouri State University is the second largest university in Missouri, and it has been growing rapidly in recent years. I have loved living in Springfield for the past two years. There are so many opportunities on and off campus. I have also worked on campus for one year with some incredible people who love what they do. I couldn't BEAR being anywhere else!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: New Mexico State University is a very beautiful campus in general it's very green, open, and the people made me feel welcomed. Staff are always willing to help students and make them feel like they're at home. Professors are approachable and are always willing to hear what you have to say. There's tremendously unique experiences that NMSU provides for students. Aside from experiences there's also different kind of activities and organizations where I can find a perfect match to what I like to do and people just get to collaborate with one another. There's over 180+ degrees in NMSU to pick from and just the fact that they had the perfect match to the degree that I wanted to pursue. A couple of things that I think the campus needs to work on is the dorms on campus, there's always something negative that's happening whether is the water, undistinguished smells, door locks. However overall it's a great campus!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: No commute! Set your own hours as long as you meet deadlines. Very organized with latest information updates. Videos and interactive lessons. Good communications with faculty and other students. Challenging, rewarding, fun, relevant topics with practical application. Competitive tuition. Smartphone application for portal. Better work life balance.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I loved the University of Rhode Island because of its dedication to make its students happy. The school constantly made changes to keep its students entertained. There are always fun events planned for students that everyone can attend. URI provides you with excellent resources to make the absolute most out of your college experience. There are hundreds of clubs and ways to get involved on campus. I lived in a Living and Learning Community, which meant I lived in a dorm with people from my major. It really helped me succeed in my classes and introduced me to so many friends!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Niche User
featuredReview.body: The University of Minnesota is a welcoming, lively, and beautiful university. They have amazing communication with the families of students and the students themselves. The campus looks like a campus that would be in a movie- absolutely stunning! The mixture of metropolitan landscape and wildlife and nature is perfect. You will never be bored at the University of Minnesota as there is always something to do, whether that be exploring downtown, going to a concert, or kayaking on one of Minnesota's thousands of lakes.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: The University of Arizona is an amazing opportunity that a lot of people can overlook. This institution has world-class professors and equipment in fields such as engineering, astrology, optics, and more. The strong athletic programs at the U fo A also bolster the school spirit and makes it easy to get fired up at sporting events with your schoolmate. As a student, you also have the best opportunity to mingle and network with industry professionals throughout the school year. Companies consistently send representative directly to the school for seminars and job fairs with the sole purpose of finding a college student to potentially employ. Having the chance to land an internship or even get a job offer at the U of A can often be a simple as showing up to a school event! To summarize, the University of Arizona is an amazing opportunity for anyone looking to get a world-class education in an environment where employers often come directly to you.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Davis empowers its student body by encouraging cultural awareness by hosting International Week, providing study abroad programs (and financial aid), having gender-inclusive restrooms throughout campus and the Student Community Center with a Cross-Cultural Center and LGBTQIA Center, a safe place for all students to hang out or study. The campus also has a beautiful Arboretum with Putah Creek running through it for some relaxing vibes and nice strolls/picnic spot.  UC Davis is one of the safest campuses with very little crimes, and people here are the friendliest, most welcoming and caring people!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: The school is definitely difficult but very rewarding. The people you are surrounded by are hardworking and good examples. The campus is absolutely beautiful! They always have fun events and activities happening on campus and they make all of the sporting events fun for all of the students by providing a roc section and letting them participate in half time games. Each of the professors are unique and their lectures are very entertaining and interesting. I feel completely safe while on campus and Provo is a fun city with a lot going on and activities to do. Overall, BYU is a great school academically and socially.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
Texas Tech University is a fantastic place to go to school. The school is vibrant, the students are largely enthusiastic, both the locals and more experienced students alike are welcoming, and most importantly, it isn't the most expensive option. With a police response time beneath a minute thanks to their blue light system set up all around campus, the massive number of resources available to the average student (including a free use 3D printer in the library!), and food that's relatively cheap with a massive student discount available, living and schooling at Texas Tech is a phenomenal experience that I would recommend to anyone looking to go to school in Texas.

So long as you don't mind the 8 hour trip to get to anywhere noteworthy, that is!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: University of Maryland -College Park is one of the top universities for the science programs it has to offer. Given its high standards, the courses are also top notch. The campus life is also very lively. Faculty and Staff are very helpful to all the students and take special care of the students in need. The university is very diverse and accommodates for everyone. One of the best security feature they have are these emergency call booths where someone can press the emergency button and the campus police will be there under 90 seconds. For the people running away from danger, they can always see one emergency call booth from another. Overall the experience at University of Maryland has been amazing and would 100% recommend!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I loved Temple University! Temple is a top academic institution, has over 140+ majors to choose from, is in the center of Philadelphia, with many alumni continuing to work in Philadelphia. Temple has a great support system, with students and teachers always willing to help. Did I mention the food options at Temple are great! There's food trucks lined up at every street! Temple University is the place to be. It is an investment you will not regret. It is an investment you will definitely reap the benefits from.  It is an honor to be "Temple Made."

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: The campus of the University is beautifully crafted and redesigned.  The blueprints were staged by former Engineering Alumni.  This significant mark on the campus is a great accomplishment and success story in its own for new students to be captivated by.  The school tours are lead by selected honors students of the university who also mentor, guide, and inspire new students.     The university has the highest number of students enrolled ever this year.  The campus is centrally located to multiple apartment buildings and restaurants.  The campus holds multiple job fairs, opportunity fairs, career progression panels, and other such organizations are well known to the community.  The welcoming to freshmen, involvement, and connection building is very prominent, including sororities and fraternities, but also with sports, ROTC programs, and other events.  Tutoring is included with tuition!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I have thoroughly enjoyed my time at Utah State University. The professors are very engaging and willing to help their students. Furthermore, USU’s campus and the city of Logan are both amazing. I am very grateful for the opportunity I have had to go to school here. My only complaint is this: the counseling office at the business school is deplorable. The counselors are unworkable, slow, and useless. Nevertheless, the school and education itself are very good. In addition, I have enjoyed the student body at USU. They are humble, hardworking, and fun. Overall, I give Utah State University a four-star rating. They provide a great education for a reasonable price. Keep up the good work USU!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Brigham Young University- Idaho is located in the little town of Rexburg, surrounded by rolling hills and farm fields. You can really feel at home here in a way few schools can make you feel at home. The campus is beautiful and the people are friendly. There's a quaint apple orchard right outside! The welcoming vibe doesn't end when you leave the campus, though. Even in my online classes, I can feel the warmth of professors and classmates that care about me. Being at BYUI is like being part of a family. Each class contains information that you can take with you as you build a career and, someday, a family of your own.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I absolutely love my university! It is a wonderful place to obtain a higher education, meet new people, and make connections that will last forever. I am most excited about finishing my bachelors, starting research in my area of study, and finding the perfect mentor. The university is always being renovated and they are bringing in local restaurants, which have some of the best food on campus! The campus is a great place to spend your whole day, whether it is spent studying, in class, or meeting with friends and professors. The campus is quite large, so it does take some time to walk from the parking areas to your classes, but there are shuttle buses available!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I am a first year transfer student from Lone Star College to Sam Houston State University. I was apprehensive and nervous about attending such a large, well-known university, but I now feel more comfortable here. I have been making good grades so far (3.5 GPA) and all of my teachers have been very open to student communication. I can tell that they genuinely want to help their students succeed. My only prominent complaint is all of the construction on campus. Maneuvering through the dirty sidewalks and the one-way streets outlined in cones can be annoying. However, I know that the finished structures will improve academics and student life in the long run, and I cannot wait to see what else Sam Houston State has in store for me in the coming semesters!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade
